title: Matrix Indexing Parentheses
explanation: MATLAB uses parentheses `()` for array indexing, not square brackets `[]`. Correct is `A(1, 2)`.

title: Zeros Function
explanation: True. Creates a 3x3 matrix of zeros.

title: Colon Operator Step
explanation:
Valid. 1:2:10 produces [1 3 5 7 9]. 
Error: `if` condition brackets? 
Code: `if (x > 0) ...`. Valid (parens optional). 
Real Error: `end` keyword missing in loop. 
Code: `for i = 1:5; disp(i);` 
Error: missing `end`. 
Snippet: `for i = 1:10; x=i;`.

title: For Loop End
explanation: Missing `end` keyword to close the `for` loop.

title: Eye Function
explanation: True. Creates a 4x4 identity matrix.

title: Matrix Multiply Elementwise
explanation: Inner dimensions must agree for matrix multiplication `*`. A is 1x2, B is 1x2. Cannot multiply. To do element-wise, use `.*`.

title: Length Vector
explanation: True. Returns 5.

title: Case Sensitive
explanation: MATLAB is case-sensitive. `Val` is not defined (only `val` is).

title: Transpose Operator
explanation: True. `'` performs conjugate transpose.

title: Function Definition File
explanation:
Valid (in file or script end). 
Error: using `==` for assignment. 
Code: `x == 5;`. 
This checks equality, does not assign. Not syntax error, but logic error if intent is assignment. 
Real Error: `elseif` spelling. `else if` (space) is invalid in MATLAB. 
Code: `if x>0; ...; else if x<0; ...; end`. 
Error: `else if` should be `elseif` (one word). If space used, it's nested if, requiring another `end`. 
Snippet: `if x>1; disp(1); else if x<1; disp(2); end`.

title: Else If Syntax
codeSnippet:
if x > 0
    disp('Pos')
else if x < 0
    disp('Neg')
end
explanation: `else if` is interpreted as a nested `if` inside an `else` block, which requires an additional `end`. The correct keyword is `elseif` (one word).

title: Size Function
explanation: True. Returns [2 2].

title: String quotes
explanation: Mismatched quotes. Double quote `"` started, single quote `'` ended. Must match.

title: Clear Command
explanation: True. Clears variables.

title: Array concatenation dimension
explanation: Rows must have the same number of columns. Row 1 has 2, Row 2 has 3.

title: Ones Matrix
explanation: True. Column vector of ones.

title: Comment syntax
explanation: MATLAB uses `%` for comments, not `#`.

title: Logical indexing
explanation: True. Returns [2 3].

title: Semicolon suppress
explanation:
Valid. x prints, y does not. 
Error: `while` loop syntax. 
Code: `while x > 0 do ...`. 
Error: `do` is not used. `while condition`. 
Snippet: `while x > 0 do`.

title: While Loop Do
explanation: MATLAB `while` loops do not use the `do` keyword. Syntax is `while condition ... end`.

title: Global Variable
explanation: True. Declares global variable.

title: Cell array braces
explanation: Mismatched delimiters. Started with `{`, ended with `]`. Use `{...}` for cells.

title: Plot Function
explanation: True. Plots x vs y.

title: Mean function dimension
explanation:
Valid (mean over 3rd dim). 
Error: function without output assignment? Valid. 
Real Error: `1./A` vs `1/A`. 
Code: `1 / [1 2]`. Right division (slash). `1 ./ [1 2]` Elementwise. 
Real Error: undefined function. 
Code: `pritn('hello')`. 
Error: Typo `pritn`. 
Snippet: `pritn('Hello')`.

title: Typo Function
explanation: Typo in function name `pritn`. Should be `print` or `disp` or `fprintf`.

title: Struct creation
explanation: True. Creates a structure `s`.

title: Matrix vector mismatch
explanation:
Element-wise multiplication `.*` requires compatible sizes (or implicit expansion in newer MATLAB). A (2x2) and v (2x1). In old MATLAB, error 'Matrix dimensions must agree'. Newer MATLAB supports implicit expansion. 
Assume standard strict or older compatibility? 
Let's use clearly wrong dimensions. 
`v = [1 2 3]`. 
`A = [1 2; 3 4]` (2x2). `v` (1x3). 
`A .* v` -> Error.

title: Incompatible Dimensions
explanation: Matrix dimensions are incompatible for element-wise addition (2x2 vs 1x3).

title: Disp string
explanation: False (mostly). In older MATLAB, this adds 5 to ASCII codes. New MATLAB `"string" + 5` works. `'char' + 5` results in numeric array. Code usually intends `disp(['Value: ' num2str(5)])`. Is it an error? No, runs but prints numbers. `isCodeCorrect: false` logically.

title: Continue outside loop
explanation: `continue` statement is only valid within `for` or `while` loops.

title: Clc Command
explanation: True. Clears command window.

title: Index start 0
explanation: MATLAB uses 1-based indexing. Indices must be positive integers.

title: Save Command
explanation: True. Saves workspace variables to file.

title: Load invalid syntax
explanation:
Command syntax `load data.mat` is valid. Function syntax `load('data.mat')` is valid. 
Error: `return` value? 
Code: `return 5;`. 
Error: `return` in MATLAB does not take a value. It just exits function. Output variable must be assigned before return. 
Snippet: `function y=f(); y=1; return 5; end`.

title: Return Value
explanation: `return` in MATLAB does not accept arguments. It simply returns control. Return values are determined by assignments to output variables (e.g., `y`).

title: Rand Function
explanation: True. Generates 1x5 random numbers (0-1).

title: Double operator usage
explanation: `++` is not a MATLAB operator (increment). Use `x = 1 + 2` or `x = x + 1`.

title: Hold On
explanation: True. Retains current plot.

title: Switch case syntax
explanation: `case` does not use a colon `:`. Syntax is `case 1`, then statements. New line or comma separator.

title: Input Function
explanation: True. Prompts user for input.

title: Power operator elementwise
explanation: `^` is matrix power (requires square matrix). For element-wise power, use `.^`.

title: Whos Command
explanation: True. Lists variables with details.

title: Logical NOT operator
explanation: `!` is usually shell escape in MATLAB command window. Logical NOT is `~`. `if ~x`.

title: Diff Function
explanation: True. Returns [2 3].

title: Class definition syntax
explanation: Class definition starts with `classdef MyClass`, not `class`. `class` is a function returning type.

title: Empty vector
explanation: True. Creates empty array.

title: Anonymous function syntax
explanation:
Anonymous function body does not use `{}` (unless creating cell). Standard math function is `sq = @(x) x.^2;`. Not strictly error if cell wanted. 
Real Error: `lambda` syntax `->`. 
Code: `f = x -> x^2`. 
Error: MATLAB uses `@(x) x^2`.

title: Lambda Syntax
explanation: Invalid syntax for anonymous function. Use `f = @(x) x + 1;`.

title: Find Function
explanation: True. Returns indices [1 3].

title: Persistent variable context
explanation: `persistent` variables can only be declared inside a function, not in a script or command window.

title: Isnan Function
explanation: True. Returns logical 1 (true).

title: Try Catch block
explanation: MATLAB uses `catch`, not `except`.

title: Tic Toc
explanation: True. Measures elapsed time.

title: Function end in script
explanation:
In older MATLAB versions, functions in scripts must be at the end. In recent versions, local functions are allowed at end of script. If this is in middle? `x=1` (script code). `function ... end`. Script code cannot appear *after* local functions commence. 
Assume modern context: Function definitions in a script must appear at the end of the file.

title: Linspace
explanation: True. Generates 5 points from 0 to 10.

title: String concatenation operators
explanation:
Valid for string arrays (double quotes). 
Error: `&` vs `&&` logic. 
Code: `if [1 0] && [1 1]`. 
Error: `&&` takes scalar logicals. `&` takes arrays. 
Snippet: `if A && B` where A, B are vectors.

title: Short circuit AND vector
codeSnippet:
A = [1 0]; B = [1 1];
if A && B
    disp('True')
end
explanation: Short-circuit AND `&&` operates on **scalar** logical operands only. Use `&` for element-wise array logic, or `all(A) && all(B)`.

title: Diag Function
explanation: True. Creates diagonal matrix.

title: Mod function usage
explanation:
Valid. Returns 1. 
Error: `fprintf` without file ID defaults to screen? Yes. 
Real Error: `fprintf` closing parenthesis. 
Code: `fprintf('Val: %d', x`. 
Real Error: `end` in script? 
Real Error: `function` definition in script not at end (already covered). 
Real Error: `input` number vs string. 
Code: `x = input('Prompt', 's')`. Valid. 
Real Error: `zeros` size. 
Code: `zeros(1, 2, 3)`. Valid (3D). 
Real Error: `cell` indexing `()`. 
Code: `C = {1, 2}; x = C(1) + 1;` 
Error: `C(1)` returns a cell `{1}`, not the value `1`. Cannot add cell to double. Use `C{1}`.

title: Cell Array Access
explanation: `C(1)` returns a 1x1 cell array containing 10. You cannot add a number to a cell. Use curly braces `C{1}` to extract the contents (10).

title: Repmat functionality
explanation: True. Repeats matrix: 2 rows, 1 col block. Result [1 2; 1 2].

title: Equality operator assignment
explanation: `=` is assignment. Equality check uses `==`. `if x == 5`.

title: Reshape Function
explanation: True. Reshapes vector into 2x3 matrix (column-major).

title: Undefined variable
explanation: `x` is undefined (cleared).

title: Any Function
explanation: True. Returns logical 1 (true) because one element is non-zero.

title: Matrix dimension indexing
explanation: Index exceeds matrix dimensions. A has 2 rows, accessed row 3.

title: Floor Function
explanation: True. Returns 3.

title: String termination
explanation: Missing closing quote `'`.

title: Imaginary Unit
explanation: True. `i` or `1i` represents imaginary unit.

title: Else syntax
codeSnippet:
if x > 0
    disp(x)
else x < 0
    disp(-x)
end
explanation: `else` does not take a condition. Use `elseif x < 0` or just `else`.

title: Pi Constant
explanation: True. Returns 3.14159...

title: Bracket mismatch
explanation: Started with `[`, ended with `)`. Must match `]`. `[1 2 3]`.

title: Isempty Function
explanation: True. Returns logical 1.

title: fprintf argument count
explanation: Format specifier `%d` requires a value argument. `fprintf('Val: %d', x);`.

title: Round Function
explanation: True. Returns 4 (rounds to nearest).

title: Variable name start
explanation: Variable names cannot start with a number.

title: Exist Function
explanation: True. Returns number indicating type (e.g., 5 for builtin).

title: End missing
explanation: Missing `end` keyword for `if` block.

title: Nargin
explanation: True. Returns number of input arguments (1).

title: Struct access invalid
explanation: Field `b` does not exist in structure `s`.

title: Deal Function
explanation: True. Assigns inputs to outputs.

title: Matrix rows consistency
explanation: Dimensions of matrices being concatenated are not consistent. Row 1 has 2 cols, Row 2 has 1.

title: Keyboard command
explanation: True. Pauses execution and gives control to keyboard (debug mode).

title: Spaces in variable
explanation: Variable names cannot contain spaces.

title: Rng Seed
explanation: True. Sets random seed.

title: Multiple assignment indexing
explanation: Invalid syntax for RHS. `5 6` is not a matrix. Need brackets `[5 6]`. `A(1:2) = [5 6]`.

title: Eps Constant
explanation: True. Floating point relative accuracy.

title: Function output undef
explanation: Output variable `y` is declared but never assigned a value in the function.

title: Double colon
explanation: True. Decrement from 10 to 1.

title: Dot transpose
explanation:
Valid. `.'` is non-conjugate transpose. 
Error: `switch` without `case`? Valid (does nothing). 
Real Error: `break` outside loop. 
Code: `if x>0; break; end`. 
Error: `break` only in `for` or `while`.

title: Break Outside Loop
explanation: `break` statement is only allowed within a `for` or `while` loop.

title: Sort Function
explanation: True. Returns [1 2 3].

title: While condition empty
explanation: `while` requires a condition.

title: Inf Value
explanation: True. Returns Inf.

title: Operator sequence
explanation: Unexpected operator `/` after `*`.

title: Lower function
explanation: True. Returns 'abc'.

title: Undefined function
explanation: Function `plott` not found. Likely `plot`.

title: Sprintf output
explanation: True. Returns string '3.14'.

title: Reserved keyword var
explanation: `if` is a keyword. Cannot use as variable name.

title: Who Command
explanation: True. Lists variable names.

title: Matrix parentheses mismatch
explanation: Started with `[`, ended with `)`. Must use `]`.

title: Path Command
explanation: True. Returns search path.

title: String single quote escape
explanation: Single quote inside string terminates string. Escaping requires two single quotes: `'It''s me'`.

title: Mod Function
explanation: True.

title: Invalid logic operator
explanation: Less than or equal is `<=`, not `=<`.

title: Abs Function
explanation: True.

title: Function argument comma
explanation: Function arguments must be separated by commas: `plot(x, y)`.

title: Pause Command
explanation: True. Pauses for 0.5s.

title: Grid command
explanation:
Valid. Turns grid on. 
Error: `legend` before plot? 
Code: `legend('Line'); plot(x,y)`. 
Error: `legend` normally applies to existing axes/lines. If no plot, warning or empty legend. 
Real Error: `xlabel` number. 
Code: `xlabel(1)`. 
Error: `xlabel` expects string or char vector. `xlabel('1')`. 
Snippet: `xlabel(10)`.

title: Label Input Type
explanation: `xlabel` (and ylabel/title) expects a string or character vector, not a number. Use `xlabel('100')` or `xlabel(num2str(100))`.

title: Hold state
explanation: True. Returns 1 if hold is on.

title: Subplot indices
explanation: Index 5 exceeds grid 2x2 (max 4).

title: Cell2Mat
explanation: True. Converts cell array of scalars to matrix.

title: Strcmp arg count
explanation: `strcmp` compares two strings. Does not take 3 arguments.

title: Num2Str
explanation: True. Converts number to string with precision.

title: Xlim args
explanation: `xlim` expects a 2-element vector `[min max]`, not two separate arguments. `xlim([0 10])`.

title: Strcmpi
explanation: True. Case-insensitive comparison (returns true).

title: Legend location invalid
explanation: 'Bottom' is not a valid location. Use 'South', 'SouthOutside', 'Best', etc.

title: Bar Plot
explanation: True. Creates bar graph.

title: Struct field dynamic bad
explanation:
Valid. Creates field 'f'. 
Error: `s.(f) = 1` where f is number? 
Code: `f = 1; s.(f) = 1`. 
Error: Field name must be string/char. 
Snippet: `s.(1) = 10`.

title: Dynamic Field Type
explanation: Dynamic field names must be strings or character vectors. A number `100` is invalid.

title: Str2Double
explanation: True. Converts string to double.

title: Readtable file type
explanation: Filename must be a string.

title: IsStruct
explanation: True.

title: Colormap size
explanation: Colormap must be m-by-3 matrix of RGB values between 0 and 1. Negative values are invalid.

title: Imagesc
explanation: True. Displays matrix as image.

title: Axis equal invalid
explanation: Correct command is `axis equal`. 'equals' is not a valid mode.

title: Contains String
explanation: True. Returns logical 1.

title: Saveas format
explanation:
Format mismatch. Filename extension 'png' but format specified as 'jpeg'. Usually works but confusing/warning. 
Better: `saveas` invalid handle. 
Code: `saveas(0, 'f.png')`. 
Error: 0 is root object, usually can't be saved as image. Expects figure handle. 
Real Error: `print` arguments. 
Code: `print('file', -dpng)`. 
Error: `-dpng` (device) should be a string `'-dpng'`.

title: Print Device String
explanation: Device switch `-dpng` must be passed as a string: `print('plot', '-dpng')`. Or function syntax.

title: Num2Cell
explanation: True. Creates {1, 2, 3}.

title: Text coords
explanation: `text` expects numeric coordinates first: `text(x, y, 'String')`. Order is `text(1, 1, 'Hi')`.

title: IsCell
explanation: True.

title: Ylim size
explanation: `ylim` expects a 2-element vector `[min max]`.

title: Colorbar
explanation: True. Adds colorbar to axes.

title: Scatter args
explanation: `scatter` usually requires X and Y. `scatter(x, y)`. Older versions might default X? Docs say `scatter(x,y)`. `scatter(y)` not standard (unlike plot).

title: Cla Command
explanation: True. Clears axes.

title: Hold toggle
explanation: `hold` accepts 'on' or 'off'. 'true' is invalid.

title: NextPlot
explanation: True. Equivalent to `hold on`.

title: Strfind output assignment
explanation: If 'z' is not found, `strfind` returns empty `[]`. Accessing `idx(1)` throws index out of bounds error.

title: Upper Function
explanation: True (element-wise logical array of 1s).

title: Histogram bins negative
explanation: Second argument can be 'nbins' (scalar int > 0). Negative bins invalid.

title: Randn
explanation: True. Normal distribution, 2x2 matrix.

title: Funnysurf typo
explanation:
Valid. 
Error: `meshgrid` one arg? 
Code: `[X, Y] = meshgrid(1:3)`. Valid (square). 
Real Error: `contour` Z dim. 
Code: `contour(1:2, 1:2, ones(3))`. 
Error: Z size must match X/Y coordinates.

title: Contour Dimensions
explanation: Z (3x3) dimensions do not match x (length 2) and y (length 2).

title: IsChar
explanation: True.

title: WriteTable args
explanation: Filename must be a string.

title: Get Current Figure
explanation: True. Returns handle.

title: Subplot tight
explanation: `subplot` does not take 'tight' as single argument (except possibly third party toolkits). Standard is indices.

title: Diff Order
explanation: True. 2nd order difference. [1 2] -> 1.

title: Cell braces indexing
explanation: Index out of bounds. Cell has 2 elements.

title: Log10
explanation: True.

title: Strcat trailing space
explanation:
Valid. Returns 'ab'. `strcat` strips trailing whitespace from cellstr/char inputs! Not error, but often unwanted. 
Real Error: `char` conversion of struct. 
Code: `char(struct('a',1))`. 
Error: No conversion from struct to char.

title: Char Struct
explanation: Cannot convert a structure to a character array directly using `char`.

title: Mat2Str
explanation: True. Returns string representation '[1 2; 3 4]'.

title: Set invalid property
explanation: 'LineWidth' must be numeric. 'Bold' is for 'FontWeight' (text).

title: IsLogical
explanation: True.

title: Blanks missing arg
explanation: `blanks` requires length argument n.

title: Deblank
explanation: True. Removes trailing whitespace only (returns ' Hi').

title: Strjunction old
explanation: Function name is `strjoin`, not `strjunction`.

title: StrSplit
explanation: True. Returns {'a', 'b', 'c'}.

title: Strmatch deprecated
explanation:
`strmatch` is not recommended (deprecated). Use `strncmp` or `validatestring`. However, might not be strict error in some versions. 
Better: `error` usage. 
Code: `error(1, 'Msg')`. 
Error: First arg is message ID (string) or message (string). Structure `error('Msg')` or `error('ID', 'Msg')`.

title: Warning ID
explanation: True. Suppresses all warnings.

title: Ginput return
explanation:
Valid? `ginput` usually returns [x, y] or [x, y, button]. Yes, 3 outputs. 
Real Error: `uicontrol` bad style. 
Code: `uicontrol('Style', 'Button')`. 
Error: Style is 'pushbutton', 'togglebutton', etc. 'Button' is invalid key (usually).

title: Uicontrol Style
explanation: Invalid style 'Button'. Correct is 'pushbutton'.

title: Waitbar
explanation: True. Creates waitbar.

title: Msgbox syntax
explanation: Message must be string or cell array of strings. Number 123 is invalid.

title: Guidata
explanation: True. Retrieves GUI data.

title: Linkaxes dim
explanation: Valid options for dimension are 'x', 'y', 'xy', 'off'. 'z' is not standard (for 2D plots mostly). `linkaxes` doc says 'x', 'y', 'xy', 'off'. Some versions might allow 'z'?

title: Linkaxes Invalid Option
explanation: 'all' is not a valid option for `linkaxes`. Use 'xy' to link both X and Y.

title: Zoom Command
explanation: True. Enables zoom mode.

title: Patch arguments color
explanation: `patch` typically requires color argument if x, y provided. `patch(x, y, 'r')` or property-value pairs. `patch(x,y)` creates object but color default is black or error? In high-level syntax, needs Color or CData. `patch(X,Y,C)`.

title: View 3D
explanation: True. Sets view to 3D default.

title: Alpha value
explanation: Transparency alpha value must be between 0 and 1.

title: Camlight
explanation: True.

title: Daspect ratio
explanation: `daspect` takes a 3-element vector [x y z] for data aspect ratio.

title: Material Shiny
explanation: True. Sets material properties.

title: Annotation type invalid
explanation: Invalid annotation type 'circle'. Use 'ellipse'.

title: Rotate3d
explanation: True.

title: Fill color missing
explanation: Like patch, `fill` requires color argument `fill(x, y, 'r')`.

title: Hgtransform
explanation: True. Creates transform object.

title: Light position
explanation: Position must be 3-element vector [x y z].

title: Lighting Gouraud
explanation: True.

title: Camorbit args
explanation: Requires at least 2 arguments: `camorbit(dtheta, dphi)`.

title: Pbaspect
explanation: True. Plot box aspect ratio.

title: Datacursormode mode
explanation: Invalid mode 'active'. Use 'on', 'off', or 'toggle'.

title: Pan Xonly
explanation: True. Restricts panning to x-axis.

title: Linkdata error
explanation:
`linkdata` works on figure. `linkdata on` works. `linkdata(gcf)` works in some versions (boolean output)? 
Better: `brush` argument. 
Code: `brush(gcf, 'green')`. 
Error: Color must be 'r', 'g', 'b', etc? Actually brush takes 'on', 'off'. Color is separate property. `brush on`.

title: Brush Color Argument
explanation: `brush` command accepts 'on', 'off', or figure handle. To set color, use `brush` followed by operations or setting 'BrushData'. 'red' is not a valid state argument.

title: Uigetfile
explanation: True. Opens file dialog.

title: Uisetcolor input
explanation: 'Title' is not the first argument. Usually `uisetcolor(defaultColor, 'Title')` or `uisetcolor('Title')`? No, 'Title' is property? `uisetcolor` takes optional color and title string. Order matters or type. `uisetcolor('Title')` interprets string as title. `uisetcolor(1)` is erroneous color (scalar). RGB is 3-element.

title: Uiputfile
explanation: True.

title: Questdlg args
explanation: Second argument (title) must be a string. 1 is invalid.

title: Errordlg
explanation: True.

title: Listdlg liststring
explanation: 'ListString' must be a cell array of strings or char matrix. Numeric array is invalid.

title: Warndlg
explanation: True.

title: Isqc struct
explanation: Typo. Probably meant `ispc` (Windows) or `isstruct`? `isqc` is not standard.

title: Ismac
explanation: True. Returns true if macOS.

title: Computer output
explanation: `computer` returns `[str, maxsize, endian]`. 3 outputs supported.

title: Computer Input
explanation: `computer` does not take numeric arguments. `computer` or `computer('arch')`.

title: License Check
explanation: True. Checks if license exists.

title: Ver toolbox
explanation: `ver` takes a toolbox name (string).

title: Version
explanation: True. Returns version string.

title: Memory function
explanation: `memory` takes no arguments or specific feature strings. `memory` is Windows only.

title: Tempdir
explanation: True. Returns temp directory.

title: Tempname args
explanation: `tempname` takes no arguments (or a directory in updated versions?). Usually `tempname`.

title: Pwd Command
explanation: True. Current directory.

title: Cd value
explanation: Path must be string.

title: Ls Command
explanation: True.

title: Mkdir syntax
explanation: Usage `mkdir('parent', 'new')` or `mkdir('path')`. 1 is invalid.

title: Rmdir
explanation: True. Removes directory recursively.

title: Delete wildcard
explanation:
Valid? `delete *` works in command form. 
Real Error: `movefile` same source dest? 
Code: `movefile('a', 'a')`. 
Error: Error or Warning logic.

title: Copyfile Inputs
explanation: Source and destination must be strings.

title: Fileattrib
explanation: True. Gets attributes.

title: Fopen mode
explanation: Invalid mode 'rw'. Use 'r', 'w', 'r+', 'w+', 'a', etc. 'r+' leads to read/write.

title: Fclose
explanation: True. Closes all open files.

title: Fread size
explanation: 'int32s' is typo? MATLAB precisions are 'int32'. 's' might be suffix? No, usually 'integer*4' or 'int32'. 'int32s' is likely invalid.

title: Fseek
explanation: True. Rewinds to beginning of file.

title: Varargin cell
explanation: `varargin` is a cell array. `varargin(1)` returns a cell. Cannot add 1 to a cell. Use `varargin{1}`.

title: OnCleanup usage
explanation: True. Executes callback when `c` is cleared (e.g., function exit).

title: Parfor variable classification
explanation:
Valid? `y` is temporary variable in parfor. Accessing `y` after loop is invalid if not reduction/sliced. `y` is undefined after loop? Correct. `y` is temporary loop variable. Not available outside. 
Real Error: `addlistener` source. 
Code: `addlistener('event', @cb)`. 
Error: Source object required. `addlistener(obj, 'event', @cb)`.

title: AddListener Source
explanation: `addlistener` requires an event source object as the first argument: `addlistener(src, 'MyEvent', @myCb)`.

title: InputParser
explanation: True. parses input 10 for required 'x'.

title: Sparse indexing
explanation:
Valid, but assigning 0 to sparse element explicitly? Removes it (if it was non-zero) or does nothing. Valid syntax. 
Real Error: `classdef` property default. 
Code: `properties; x = rand(); end`. 
Error: Property default values must be constant or deterministic? Actually, `rand()` is evaluated once when class is loaded (not per instance), which is a common gotcha, but syntactically valid. 
Real Error: `methods` declaration. 
Code: `methods (Static = true, Access = private)`. 
Error: `Access = private` should be just `Access = private`? or `Access = 'private'`. MATLAB is flexible. 
Real Error: `global` in parfor. 
Code: `parfor i=1:5; global g; g=i; end`. 
Error: `global` is not allowed in `parfor`.

title: Global in Parfor
explanation: `global` variables cannot be declared or used inside a `parfor` loop body.

title: Meta Class
explanation: True. Returns `meta.class` object for `handle` class.

title: Timer start delay
explanation: 'StartDelay' must be non-negative.

title: Bsxfun
explanation: True. Binary Singleton Expansion. Result 2x2.

title: InputParser output
explanation: Results are in `p.Results`, not directly on `p`. Access `p.Results.x`.

title: Cellfun
explanation: True. Applies function to each cell.

title: Dynamic property attributes
explanation:
`dynamicprops` is a class (handle mixin). Must inherit from it or `addprop` on instance of class inheriting `dynamicprops`. Cannot instantiate `dynamicprops` directly? Actually docs say 'abstract class'? In recent versions implies inheriting. 
Snippet assume `obj` is valid instance. `p.SetMethod` handles property set. Logic OK. 
Error: `SetMethod` signature. Must take `(obj, val)`. 
Snippet code: `@(x) x`. One arg. 
Real Error: Assigning value to property in `SetMethod` causes recursion if not careful, but here syntax is just function handle. 
Let's use `parfor` sliced variable indexing. 
Code: `parfor i=1:10; A(i+1) = i; end`. 
Error: Indexing `A(i+1)` is not a valid sliced variable index? It is valid (shifted). `A(i)` is standard. `A(2*i)` valid. `A(i+1)` valid. 
What about `A(i, i)`? 
Real Error: `nested` function in `parfor`. 
Code: `parfor i=1:10; f(); end`. 
Valid. 
Real Error: `persistent` in `parfor`. 
Code: `parfor i=1:10; myFun(); end` -> `function myFun; persistent p; ...`. 
Error: `persistent` variables in functions called by parfor are undefined/reset or lead to warnings/errors because workers are independent.

title: Persistent in Parfor
explanation: Persistent variables (and globals) behavior is undefined or inconsistent in `parfor` workers because memory is not shared. Each worker has own copy, updates are lost.

title: Memmapfile
explanation: True. Maps file to memory.

title: Java method static call
explanation: `javaMethod` first arg is method name, second is class. Signature: `javaMethod('methodName', 'className', args...)`. Code has class first.

title: Arrayfun UniformOutput
explanation: True. Returns cell array because outputs vary in size/content (non-scalar).

title: EventData name
explanation: `event.EventData` constructor does not take the event name as argument. It stores data. Name is determined by the event triggered. Constructor implies empty or specific subclass.

title: Str2Func
explanation:
True. Creates function handle from string (even anon func syntax works in newer versions, or converts name). Note: `str2func('sin')` standard. `str2func('@(x)x')` works in some contexts? Actually, docs say `str2func` creates handle to function *named* by string. It does *not* parse '@(x)...'. That would require `str2func` on a name or `eval`. Wait. `str2func(str)` where str is function name. 
If str is '@(x)x', it fails? 
Test: `f = str2func('@(x)x^2')` -> Error: 'The function name must be a valid identifier'. 
So this code is False (Error).

title: Loadlibrary inputs
explanation: Argument order reversed. `loadlibrary('shrlib', 'header')`. `loadlibrary('mylib.dll', 'mylib.h')`.

title: Profile Resume
explanation: True. Resumes profiling.

title: Spmd composite access
explanation: Composite object indexing uses 1-based indices (like workers). `x{1}` etc. `x{0}` invalid.

title: Labindex
explanation: True. Returns worker index.

title: Timer period
explanation:
Minimum timer period is limited (usually 0.001s, 1ms). 0.0001 might be rounded or error depending on system, but usually 1ms constraint exists. On Windows, 0.001 is limit. Is it error? No, often clamps or is accepted but runs slower. 
Better: `ExecutionMode` default. 
Code: `t = timer('Period', 1); start(t);`. 
Error: Default `ExecutionMode` is 'singleShot'. Period is ignored unless mode is repetitive.

title: Timer SingleShot
explanation: Valid, but won't repeat. Default mode is 'singleShot'. To repeat, set 'ExecutionMode' to 'fixedRate' etc. Not strict syntax error, but logic flaw if period set.

title: Parfeval
explanation: True. Asynchronously evaluates `magic(5)` (1 output).

title: Mlock in script
explanation:
`mlock` locks the currently running function or script in memory. Used in scripts? Yes. 
Error: `munlock` file? 
Real Error: `classdef` inheritance syntax. 
Code: `classdef MyClass inherits Handle` 
Error: `classdef MyClass < Handle`.

title: Class Inheritance
explanation: MATLAB uses `<` for inheritance: `classdef MyClass < handle`.

title: IsFunctionHandle
explanation: True.

title: Constructor return
codeSnippet:
classdef A
    methods
        function obj = A()
            return obj;
        end
    end
end
explanation: Keywords `return obj` are invalid for returning value. Just `return` (void) or assume assignment to `obj`. In constructor `obj = A()`, `obj` is output variable. `return` does not take argument.

title: Superclass call
explanation: True. Calls superclass constructor.

title: Property validation syntax
explanation: Default value `-1` violates validation function `mustBePositive`. Error at class load/instantiation.

title: Access Private
explanation: True.

title: Abstract method body
explanation: Abstract methods cannot have an implementation (body). Use `function foo(obj); end` or just signature.

title: Sealed class
explanation: True. Cannot be subclassed.

title: Static method access
codeSnippet:
classdef A
    methods (Static)
        function f(), end
    end
end
obj = A();
val = obj.f();
explanation:
Valid. Static methods *can* be called from instances `obj.f()`. 
Error: `delete` method usage. 
Code: `destroy(obj)`. 
Error: MATLAB uses `delete(obj)`.

title: Destroy Object
explanation: MATLAB uses `delete(handle)` to destroy objects. `destroy` is not a standard function.

title: Package folder
explanation: True. `+` denotes package directory.

title: Enumeration syntax
explanation: Enumerations use `Member (Value)` or just `Member`. Syntax `Red = 1` is struct-like assignment, usually `Red (1)` for value-based enums if constructor defined.

title: Classdef Value Class
codeSnippet:
classdef Point
   properties; X; Y; end
end
explanation: True. Value class (dosen't inherit handle).

title: Events notify args
explanation: `notify` requires source object. `notify(src, 'EventName', data)`.

title: Mixin Copyable
explanation: True. Enables `copy(obj)`.

title: Set method output
explanation:
Property set methods `set.Prop` do not return the object (for handle classes? For value classes, they DO return object). 
Assuming value class? `obj.Prop = val` inside `set.Prop` causes infinite recursion! Must use `obj.Prop = val`. Infinite recursion. 
Actually, `set` methods in newer MATLAB use no output for handle, output for value. 
But assignment `obj.Prop=val` recurses. 
Wait. Inside set method, assignment is special? No. 
See docs: "Avoid calling the set method from within the set method..." 
Correct way? `obj.Prop = val`. This calls set method. 
Wait, how to set? 
In modern MATLAB, you don't write set methods to just set value. You used to use `obj.Prop = val`. Now you check `val` then set. 
Actually, the error is Recursion. 
Also, `obj.Prop = val` calls `set.Prop`.

title: Get Method usage
explanation: False. Accessing `obj.Prop` inside `get.Prop` calls `get.Prop` recursively. Infinite recursion loop.

title: Implicit expansion dimension
explanation: Dimensions 2x3 and 2x2 are incompatible for implicit expansion (must match or be 1).

title: Permute
explanation: True. Swaps dimensions 1 and 2.

title: Shiftdim negative
explanation:
Valid. Standard for shifting dimensions? Negative n shifts to right (adds singletons). Positive shifts left. 
Real Error: `circshift` syntax. 
Code: `circshift(A, 1, 1)`. 
Error: `circshift(A, K, dim)` or `circshift(A, K)`. If K is scalar 1, `circshift(A,1,1)` valid? `circshift(A, K, dim)` syntax exists? Docs say `circshift(A,K)` where K is vector `[shift_dim1 shift_dim2...]` or K scalar (shift first dim). `circshift(A, K, dim)` is valid (shift K along dim). 
Real Error: `reshape` total elements. 
Code: `reshape(ones(2,2), 1, 5)`. 
Error: Elements must match. 4 vs 5.

title: Reshape Elements
explanation: Total number of elements must be the same `prod(size(A))` is 4, `1*5` is 5.

title: Squeeze
explanation: True. Removes singleton dimensions. Result 2x3.

title: Cat dimensions
explanation: Concatenation along dimension 1 (rows) requires other dimensions (columns) to match. 2 vs 3.

title: Horzcat
explanation: True. Equal to `[A, B]`.

title: Vertcat dimensions
explanation: Vertical concatenation requires same number of columns.

title: Subschegn assign
explanation: True. Basic subsasgn.

title: Narginchk range
explanation: Min args (2) cannot be greater than Max args (1).

title: Nargoutchk
explanation: True.

title: Validateattributes empty
explanation:
Second argument (Classes) cannot be empty cell `{}` in most contexts if Attributes are provided? Actually, allowed classes can be empty to allow any class? No, must specify class or cell array of classes. If empty, maybe means 'any'? 
Check: `validateattributes(A, classes, attributes)`. `classes` is cell array of strings. 
Real Error: `containers.Map` keys. 
Code: `m = containers.Map({1, 2}, {'a', 'b'})`. 
Valid. 
Code: `m = containers.Map([1 2], {'a', 'b'})`. 
Error: KeySet must be cell array if keys are strings? Or numeric array ok? 
Real Error: `inputParser` param value. 
Code: `addParameter(p, 'Name')`. 
Error: `addParameter` requires default value. `addParameter(p, 'Name', default)`.

title: AddParameter Default
explanation: `addParameter` requires a default value argument. `addParameter(p, 'name', default)`.

title: Mfilename
explanation: True. Returns name of currently running script/function.

title: Assert fail
explanation: Condition is `false`, so `assert` throws error 'Failed'.

title: Polyfit
explanation: True. Linear fit.

title: Jsondecode type
explanation:
Valid. Returns struct `s.a = 1`. 
Error: `webread` url. 
Code: `webread(123)`. 
Error: Must be string. 
Real Error: `polyval` args. 
Code: `y = polyval([1 1]);`. 
Error: `polyval(p, x)` requires x (evaluation points).

title: Polyval Inputs
explanation: `polyval` requires two arguments: polynomial coefficients and values at which to evaluate `polyval(p, x)`.

title: Integral Function
explanation: True. Numerical integration.

title: Ode45 signature
explanation: ODE function signature must be `dydt = f(t, y)`. Code has `f(y,t)`. Order matters unless older format? Standard `ode45` expects `@(t,y)`.

title: Filter Function
explanation: True. 1D digital filter.

title: Conv args
explanation: `conv` (convolution) requires two vectors `u` and `v`. `conv(u, v)`.

title: GpuArray
explanation: True. Creates array on GPU (if supported).

title: Matfile writable
explanation: To write to a `matfile` object, it must be opened with 'Writable', true. `matfile('file.mat', 'Writable', true)`.

title: Parpool check
explanation: True. Get current parallel pool without creating new one.

title: Addpath string
explanation: Folder must be string or character vector.

title: RestoreDefaultPath
explanation: True. Resets path.

title: Webread url
explanation: Typo in protocol 'htttp'. `http` or `https`.

title: JsonEncode
explanation: True. Returns '{"a":1}'.

title: Audioread output
explanation: `audioread` returns `[y, fs]`. Bits is not returned (use `audioinfo`). Older `wavread` returned bits.

title: Sound Function
explanation: True. Plays sound.

title: Publish format
explanation: Second argument should be options struct or property set. `publish('script.m', 'format', 'pdf')` or struct `opts.format = 'pdf'`. Passing string 'pdf' directly is not standard syntax (might be interpreted as output dir? No). Usage `publish('file', 'option', value, ...)`.

title: GetFrame
explanation: True. Captures axes/figure frame.

title: Movie input
explanation: `movie` expects a vector of movie frames (structs with cdata/colormap), not a numeric vector.

title: Uitable Check
explanation: True. Creates table UI component.

title: Uimenu parent
explanation: Parent must be handle to figure or uimenu. 1 is likely invalid handle unless figure 1 exists? If figure 1 doesn't exist, error. Safe code uses `uimenu(gcf)` or `uimenu('Parent', f)`.

title: Dbstop Error
explanation: True. Enters debug mode on error.

title: MException constructor
explanation: Constructor requires `ID` and `Message`. `MException('ID:Tag', 'Msg')`.

title: TicToc Output
explanation: True. `t` contains elapsed time.

title: Assignin workspace
explanation: Invalid workspace 'global'. Use 'base' or 'caller'. Global variables handled via `global` keyword.

title: Evalin
explanation: True. Evaluates in base workspace.

title: Regexp output
explanation:
Valid. Returns cell array of matches. 
Error: `regexprep` args. 
Code: `regexprep('str', 'pat')`. 
Error: Requires replacement string. `regexprep('str', 'pat', 'rep')`.

title: Regexprep Args
explanation: Missing replacement argument. `regexprep(str, expression, replace)`.

title: Strtrim
explanation: True. Returns 'a'.

title: Setdiff arg count
explanation: `setdiff` requires two sets. `setdiff(A, B)`.

title: Union
explanation: True. Returns [1 2 3].

title: Unique rows logic
explanation: 'columns' is not a valid flag for `unique`. Use 'rows' or default (sorted list of elements). Older versions might support 'rows'? Yes. 'columns' invalid.

title: Intersect
explanation: True. Returns 2.

title: Cross dims
explanation: `cross` product requires vectors of length 3.

title: Dot Product
explanation: True. Returns 11.

title: Sub2ind size
explanation: Row subscript 3 is out of range for size [2 2].

title: Ind2Sub
explanation: True. Returns r=1, c=2.

title: Isempty args
explanation: `isempty` takes one argument.

title: Ismember
explanation: True.

title: Zeros args
explanation:
Valid. `zeros([sz])` works. 
Error: `mean` dim index 0. 
Code: `mean(A, 0)`. 
Error: Dimension must be positive integer.

title: Mean Dimension
explanation: Dimension argument must be a positive integer scalar. 0 is invalid.

title: Cumsum
explanation: True. Returns [1 3 6].

title: Reshape total
explanation: Vector length 5 cannot be reshaped into 2x3 (6 elements).

title: Transpose dot
explanation: True. Non-conjugate transpose.

title: Size dim
explanation:
Valid. Returns 1 (singleton). 
Error: `end` usage in script start? No. 
Error: `global` declaration assignment. 
Code: `global g = 1`. 
Error: `global g; g=1;`. Cannot assign in declaration statement.

title: Global Assignment
explanation: Initialize global variables in a separate statement. `global x; x = 10;`.

title: Persist
codeSnippet: function f; persistent p; p=1; end
explanation: True.

title: Plot3 args
explanation: `plot3` requires x, y, z arguments (triplets).

title: Fminsearch
explanation: True. Finds minimum.

title: Function optional return
explanation: Function declares output `y` but does not assign it.

title: Varargout
explanation: True. Variable output args.

title: Loop index assignment
explanation:
Valid. Overwriting loop index inside loop is allowed (though bad practice), loop continues with *next* value in vector. 
Real Error: `return` arg. 
Code: `return 5`. 
Already covered. 
Real Error: `if` condition vector. 
Code: `if [0 1]; disp(1); end`. 
Error/Warning: `if` condition should be scalar. In old MATLAB `if` on vector tested `all(vec)`. In new MATLAB, strict? No, still `all`. 
Real Error: `switch` condition cell? 
Code: `switch {1}; case 1; end`. 
Error: Switch expression must be scalar or char vector.

title: Switch Expression Type
explanation: Switch expression cannot be a cell array. Must be scalar numeric, char vector, string, etc.

title: Function handle array
explanation: True. Cell array of function handles.
